paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision maintains a consistent look and feel, where possible, within Visual Studio .NET. The Type Nodes, found under namespaces, in assemblies.xmlAssembly Nodes display .NET types from an assembly as the Visual Studio .NET vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser would. The .NET type icons and their representation can be found in the Visual Studio .NET vxgrfClassViewIcons 0 Class View and Object Browser Icons documentation.

The type name displayed is predominantly the actual .NET type name, how it appears in the assembly manifest. Concatenated is the converted Eiffel-case class name, in upper-case and between {...}. The Eiffel-casing is a product of the ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/90_assembly_formatting.xmlReferenced Assembly Type and Feature Name Conversion performed when a project is ../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuilt. The Eiffel name will also be prefixed with an specified ../../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/reference.xmlclass_name_prefixClass Name Prefix yielding the actual class name that is usable from your project, when using ../../eiffel_editor/intellisense.xmlIntellisense Features in the editor and the like.

Highlighting the .NET type, by clicking on it, will populate the Members section of the vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser will all of the members.xmlMembers that are cpconWhatIsCommonLanguageSpecification 0 Common Language Specification Compliant or are otherwise supported by the Eiffel for .NET compiler. For more information on these nodes, see members.xmlObject Browse Member Nodes.
Expanding .NET type nodes displays extended information provided by EiffelEnvision. The following describes each of the nodes and their content:

Ancestors ../images/class/hier_class_ancestors.ico
A tree of ancestor classes inherited by the expanded .NET type.

Creation Routines ../images/feature/hier_feature_creators.ico
Available only when an instance of the .NET type can be created. This node populates the Members pane, when highlighted, with the Eiffel ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcreation routines.

Inherited Features ../images/feature/hier_feature_inherited.ico
This node populates the Members pane, when highlighted, with only the inherited members.xmlMembers accessible from the expanded .NET type.

All Features ../images/feature/hier_feature_all.ico
This node populates the Members pane, when highlighted, with the all available members.xmlMembers accessible from the expanded .NET type.

The descriptions for .NET types will be shown using Eiffel-casing for class names, as per the ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/90_assembly_formatting.xmlReferenced Assembly Type and Feature Name Conversion. Descriptions will only be present when the vxconCommentingCode 0 XML documentation is available for the referenced assembly.

link.label: Visual Studio .NET Class View and Object Browser Icons
